# Enter your code here. Read input from STDIN. Print output to STDOUT
n,m = map(int,input().split())
a = list(map(int,input().split()))
A = set(map(int,input().split()))
B = set(map(int,input().split()))
happiness = 0
for i in a:
    if i in A:
        happiness += 1
    elif i in B:
        happiness -= 1
print(happiness)


import sys

def main():
    t = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    for _ in range(t):
        a, b = map(int, sys.stdin.readline().split())
        print(b - a%b)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()


# SOLUTION
# This is just a simple application of modulo operation. The minimum number of moves will be the difference between a and the remainder when a is divided by b. Runtime: O(t)

t = int(input())
for _ in range(t):
    a, b = map(int, input().split())
    print(a % b)

#!/usr/bin/env python3

import sys

def main():
    t = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    for _ in range(t):
        a, b = map(int, sys.stdin.readline().split())
        print(b - a % b, end='')

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
# PROBLEM
# https://www.codechef.com/problems/FLOW018

# SOLUTION
# This is just a simple application of modulo operation.
# The minimum number of moves will be the difference between
# a and the remainder when a is divided by b.
# Runtime: O(t)

t = int(input())
for _ in range(t):
    a, b = map(int, input().split())
    print(a % b)

    print(A % B)
import sys

def main():
    t = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    for _ in range(t):
        a, b = map(int, sys.stdin.readline().split())
        print(b - a % b)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

# SOLUTION
# This is just a simple application of modulo operation.
# The minimum number of moves will be the difference between
# a and the remainder when a is divided by b.
# Runtime: O(t)

t = int(input())
for _ in range(t):
    a, b = map(int, input().split())
    print(a % b)
